docs.text: Welcome to Vebview.JS Docs Vebview.JS, is a new way of creating applications with web technologies.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Vebview.JS, is a new way of creating applications with web technologies.
docs.title: Welcome to Vebview.JS Docs

docs.text: app.config { "title":"Vebview.JS", "default_size":{ "width":640, "height":480 }, "port":7001, "main_page":"index.html", "debug":false, "decorated":true, "maximized":false, "resizable":true, "localhost":true, "custom_backend":"", "cloud_loading":false, "mount_folder":"res" } This json file should placed at ./app.config or ./res/app.config . Application Mode If "localhost":true , sets application mode as localhost . Else if "custom_backend"!="" , sets application mode as custom backend . Else if "cloud_loading":true , sets application mode as cloud loading Else, sets application mode as "file://" If your application uses localhost and works fine with file:// protocol, you should use file:// instead of localhost . Because localhost uses more power than file:// . port It's only required when you use localhost . mount_folder mount_folder sets the folder as root in localhost and file:// . Else, it's useless. main_page If you use localhost or file:// , main_page should be relative (like index.html ), else if you use cloud loading or custom backend , main_page should be full path (like http://localhost:8000/index.html ). debug debug allows open to developer tools. resizable It's useless when you use "decorated":false . decorated If you want to make borderless window, you should look tips . custom_backend If you want to external server for application, write into custom_backend (like python3 -m http.server ).
docs.title: App Config

docs.text: { "title":"Vebview.JS", "default_size":{ "width":640, "height":480 }, "port":7001, "main_page":"index.html", "debug":false, "decorated":true, "maximized":false, "resizable":true, "localhost":true, "custom_backend":"", "cloud_loading":false, "mount_folder":"res" } This json file should placed at ./app.config or ./res/app.config .
docs.title: app.config

docs.text: If "localhost":true , sets application mode as localhost . Else if "custom_backend"!="" , sets application mode as custom backend . Else if "cloud_loading":true , sets application mode as cloud loading Else, sets application mode as "file://" If your application uses localhost and works fine with file:// protocol, you should use file:// instead of localhost . Because localhost uses more power than file:// .
docs.title: Application Mode

docs.text: It's only required when you use localhost .
docs.title: port

docs.text: mount_folder sets the folder as root in localhost and file:// . Else, it's useless.
docs.title: mount_folder

docs.text: If you use localhost or file:// , main_page should be relative (like index.html ), else if you use cloud loading or custom backend , main_page should be full path (like http://localhost:8000/index.html ).
docs.title: main_page

docs.text: debug allows open to developer tools.
docs.title: debug

docs.text: It's useless when you use "decorated":false .
docs.title: resizable

docs.text: If you want to make borderless window, you should look tips .
docs.title: decorated

docs.text: If you want to external server for application, write into custom_backend (like python3 -m http.server ).
docs.title: custom_backend

docs.text: app-region <* app-region="drag|nw-resize"></*> drag: makes the region draggable nw-resize: make the region resizable Other objects, could block actions. You can use, z-index and pointer-events for other objects or you can give the attribute.
docs.title: app-region

docs.text: <* app-region="drag|nw-resize"></*> drag: makes the region draggable nw-resize: make the region resizable Other objects, could block actions. You can use, z-index and pointer-events for other objects or you can give the attribute.
docs.title: app-region

docs.text: vebview.assign & vebview.unassign Maximum one object will be assigned, new assigns will unassign old assigned object. Unassign functions clears assigned object before .assign.title([HTML Object]) Assigns objects as title. When changed title, the object's text will be changed with title. .unassign.title()
docs.title: assign/unassign

docs.text: Maximum one object will be assigned, new assigns will unassign old assigned object. Unassign functions clears assigned object before
docs.title: vebview.assign & vebview.unassign

docs.text: Assigns objects as title. When changed title, the object's text will be changed with title.
docs.title: .assign.title([HTML Object])

docs.text: vebview.window .set_title(title?) Sets title of window. If title parameter was empty, clears title of window. .maximize() .minimize() .unmaximize() .unminimize() .fullscreen() .is_maximized() bool .move(x?, y?) Moves window to x, y. You should use all parameters. .move_by(x?, y?) Moves window to x, y as relative. .is_fullscreen() bool .new() Work in Progress (Will be changed behavior in future). You should don't use the function until finish. .set_decoration(bool) Sets decoration of window. .toggle_maximize() .toggle_fullscreen() .close() .set_resizable(bool) Sets resizability of window. If window doesn't have decoration, if will not work. If you want to have resizable borderless window, look at Borderless Window .set_always_on_top(bool) .is_always_on_top() bool .toggle_always_on_top() .set_icon(file, exts?) Sets windows icon. Exts parameter is extension of file for operating system (Windows: .ico, Linux: .png). - app_icon.png - app_icon.ico .set_icon("app_icon") If you want to set icon from website, you should download first. http.download .focus() .resize(x?, y?) Resizes window to x, y. You should use all parameters. .resize_by(x?, y?) Resizes window to x, y as relative. .is_decorated() bool .get_title() string
docs.title: window

docs.text: Sets title of window. If title parameter was empty, clears title of window.

docs.text: Sets windows icon. Exts parameter is extension of file for operating system (Windows: .ico, Linux: .png). - app_icon.png - app_icon.ico .set_icon("app_icon") If you want to set icon from website, you should download first. http.download
docs.title: .set_icon(file, exts?)

docs.text: Resizes window to x, y. You should use all parameters.
docs.title: .resize(x?, y?)

docs.text: Resizes window to x, y as relative.
docs.title: .resize_by(x?, y?)

docs.text: Borderless Window Tips Titlebar You can assign title with .assign.title . For window controls, you can use .window.minimize , .window.toggle_maximize , .window.close , .window.toggle_always_on_top . Movable To make some regions like titlebar movable, you can use *[app-region="move"] . Resizable To make some regions like corner of window resizable, you can use *[app-region="nw-resize"] .
docs.title: Borderless Window

docs.text: You can assign title with .assign.title . For window controls, you can use .window.minimize , .window.toggle_maximize , .window.close , .window.toggle_always_on_top .
docs.title: Titlebar

docs.text: To make some regions like titlebar movable, you can use *[app-region="move"] .
docs.title: Movable

docs.text: To make some regions like corner of window resizable, you can use *[app-region="nw-resize"] .
docs.title: Resizable
